_comment: Created by NCODowd on 24/05/2016 16:32:03 using v2.7
title: How does the proportion of people with learning disabilities living in their own home vary across England?
analysis_commentary: In 2014-15 there was large variation between different regions in England in terms of the proportion of people with learning disabilities living in their own home or with their family. This was highest in the North West (87.9%) and lowest the in West Midlands (62.6%) - a 25 percentage point difference.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care Outcomes Framework
